intro: Stenanthemum newbeyi, commonly known as the Newbey's stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
